entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Maritime Labour Convention) (Hours of Work) (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Merchant Shipping (Hours of Work) Regulations 2002. They implement the following provisions relating to seafarers’ leave entitlements:

entry.title: The Building Society Insolvency Rules (Northern Ireland) 2014
entry.summary: The main features of building society insolvency are that, in the event of a building society becoming insolvent, it enables those depositors who are eligible for compensation under the Financial Services Compensation Scheme (FSCS) to either receive compensation for their unpaid deposits as soon as possible after the society goes into building society.

entry.title: The HGV Road User Levy (Exemption of Vehicles) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations exempt certain articulated heavy goods vehicles (“HGVs”) from being charged the HGV Road User Levy (“the Levy”).

entry.title: The Teachers’ Superannuation (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Teachers' Superannuation Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998.

entry.title: The Employment Rights (Increase of Limits) Order (Northern Ireland) 2014
entry.summary: This Order increases, from 16th February 2014, the limits applying to certain awards of industrial tribunals, the Fair Employment Tribunal or Labour Relations Agency statutory arbitration, and other amounts payable under employment legislation, as specified in the Schedule to the Order.

entry.title: The M1/Trunk Road T3 and M1-M2 Link (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2014
The Further Education Loans (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Further Education Loans Regulations 2012 to remove the Advanced Apprenticeship Framework and the Higher Apprenticeship Framework from the list of further education courses designated under regulation 4(1) of those Regulations, and make consequential changes.

entry.title: The Inspectors of Education, Children’s Services and Skills Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order appoints the persons named in the Schedule as Her Majesty’s Inspectors of Education, Children’s Services and Skills.

title.div: The Residential Property Tribunal Procedures and Fees (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2014 / Rheoliadau Gweithdrefnau a Ffioedd Tribiwnlys Eiddo Preswyl (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2014

div.p: These Regulations make amendments to the Residential Property Tribunal Procedures and Fees (Wales) Regulations 2012 (S.I. 2012/531) (“the Principal Regulations”) as a result of the introduction of universal credit by Part 1 of the Welfare Reform Act 2012.

Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Gweithdrefnau a Ffioedd Tribiwnlys Eiddo Preswyl (Cymru) 2012 (O.S. 2012/531) (“y Prif Reoliadau”) o ganlyniad i gyflwyno credyd cynhwysol gan Ran 1 o Ddeddf Diwygio Lles 2012.

entry.title: The Legal Officers (Annual Fees) (Amendment) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order amends the Legal Officers (Annual Fees) Order 2013 (‘the 2013 Order’) in consequence of the Dioceses of Bradford, Ripon and Leeds and Wakefield Reorganisation Scheme (‘the Scheme’). The Scheme, which comes into effect on 20th April 2014, abolishes the dioceses of Bradford, Ripon and Leeds and Wakefield and creates in their place a new diocese of West Yorkshire and the Dales. This Order substitutes for the table of fees in the 2013 Order a new table which provides for fees apportioned on a pro-rata basis to be paid to the registrars of the three dioceses abolished by the Scheme and to the registrar of the new diocese.

entry.title: The Judicial Pensions (Widows’, Widowers’ and Children’s Benefits) (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: The Judicial Pensions (Widows’ and Children’s Benefits) Regulations 1987 and the Judicial Pensions (Widowers’ and Children’s Benefits) Regulations 1991 currently enable contributions covering the cost of survivor benefits to be taken from members of the Judicial Pensions Act 1981 (c. 20) pension schemes. This instrument amends the 1987 and 1991 Regulations so that they also apply to members who marry a person of the same sex.

entry.title: The National Assistance (Assessment of Resources) Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Assistance (Assessment of Resources) Regulations 1992 (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations concern the assessment of a person’s liability to pay for accommodation provided under the Social Work (Scotland) Act 1968 (“the 1968 Act”). By virtue of section 87(3) of the 1968 Act, accommodation provided under the 1968 Act or section 25 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 shall be regarded as accommodation provided under Part III of the National Assistance Act 1948.

entry.title: The Crime and Courts Act 2013 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order is the eighth commencement order made under the Crime and Courts Act 2013 (c. 22). It brings into force section 45 of and Schedule 17 to that Act, which make provision for deferred prosecution agreements.

entry.title: The Commons (Town and Village Greens) (Trigger and Terminating Events) Order 2014

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Commons (Town and Village Greens) (Trigger and Terminating Events) Order 2013

entry.summary: This Order amends Schedule 1A to the Commons Act 2006 (“the 2006 Act”) which sets out events which will exclude the right to apply for the designation of a town and village green under section 15(1) of that Act (“trigger events”) and corresponding events which will cause the exclusion to subsequently lift (“terminating events”).

entry.title: The Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013 (Commencement No. 5, Transitional Provisions and Savings) Order 2014
entry.summary: This is the fifth Commencement Order made under the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013 (c. 24) (“the Act”). Certain provisions came into force on the passing of the Act. Provisions commenced by previous Commencement Orders are noted below.

entry.title: The Transfer of Functions (Elections) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order in Council is made under section 1 of the Ministers of the Crown Act 1975. It makes provision for various functions of the Secretary of State in relation to elections of police and crime commissioners to be exercisable concurrently with the Lord President of the Council.

entry.title: The European Union (Definition of Treaties) (Colombia and Peru Trade Agreement) Order 2014

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The European Union (Definition of Treaties) (Colombia and Peru Trade Agreement) Order 2013

entry.summary: On 26th June 2012, the European Union and all its Member States signed the Trade Agreement between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part (the “Agreement”). Peru and Colombia signed the Agreement on the same day. The Agreement has been provisionally applied since 1st March 2013 (as regards Peru) and since 1st August 2013 (as regards Colombia). It will enter into force between the EU and Colombia and Peru respectively on the first day of the month following the date on which the Depositary established under the Agreement receives notification in writing that the relevant Parties have completed their internal procedures, as required for the entry into force of the Agreement as between them, or on such other date as the Parties may agree.

entry.title: The National Assistance (Sums for Personal Requirements) (Scotland) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: Section 22(4) of the National Assistance Act 1948 as applied by section 87(3) and (4) of the Social Work (Scotland) Act 1968 (“the 1968 Act”) requires a local authority to assume in assessing a person’s liability to pay for accommodation provided under the 1968 Act or section 25 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 that they will need for their personal requirements such sum per week as may be prescribed by regulations.

entry.title: The Council Tax (Discounts) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order amends the Council Tax (Discounts) (Scotland) Consolidation and Amendment Order 2003 (“the 2003 Order”) which makes provision for prescribed persons to be disregarded when calculating the amount of council tax payable by a household in Scotland.
